actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-519, by Mr. Beilenson.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5132 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. All points of order against the bill and against its consideration for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 2(l)(6) of rule XI and with clauses 2 and 7 of rule XXI are waived. Measure will be read by section. Amendments are not permitted unless the Chairman yields for such a purpose.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 130.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
UNFINISHED BUSINESS - At the conclusion of debate, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the resolution would be resumed after the recess.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 262 - 139 (Roll no. 123).
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 298 - 106 (Roll no. 124).
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5132) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations for disaster assistance to meet urgent needs because of calamities such as those which occurred in Los Angeles and Chicago, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 5132 (dire supplemental emergency appropriations).

titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5132) making dire emergency supplemental appropriations for disaster assistance to meet urgent needs because of calamities such as those which occurred in Los Angeles and Chicago, for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
